title: A student sets up an experiment with a cart on …

content.question: PHYSICS C: MECHANICS SECTION II Time - 45 minutes 3 Questions Directions: The suggested time is about 15 minutes for the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. Show all your work for each part of the question. 1. A student sets up an experiment with a cart on a level horizontal track. The cart is attached with an elastic cord to a force sensor that is fixed in place on the left end of the track. A motion sensor is at the right end of the track, as shown in the figure above. The cart is given an initial speed of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>v</mi> <mn>0</mn> </msub> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2.0</mn> <mtext> m/s</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamODamaaBa aaleaacaaIWaaabeaakiabg2da9iaaikdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaabcca caqGTbGaae4laiaabohaaaa@3E4A@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> and moves with this constant speed until the elastic cord exerts a force on the cart. The motion of the cart is measured with the motion detector, and the force the elastic cord exerts on the cart is measured with the force sensor. Both sensors are set up so that the positive direction is to the left. The data recorded by both sensors are shown in the graphs of velocity as a function of time and force as a function of time below. (a) Calculate the mass m of the cart.

frqParts.text: PHYSICS C: MECHANICS SECTION II Time - 45 minutes 3 Questions Directions: The suggested time is about 15 minutes for the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. Show all your work for each part of the question. 1. A student sets up an experiment with a cart on a level horizontal track. The cart is attached with an elastic cord to a force sensor that is fixed in place on the left end of the track. A motion sensor is at the right end of the track, as shown in the figure above. The cart is given an initial speed of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>v</mi> <mn>0</mn> </msub> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2.0</mn> <mtext> m/s</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamODamaaBa aaleaacaaIWaaabeaakiabg2da9iaaikdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaabcca caqGTbGaae4laiaabohaaaa@3E4A@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> and moves with this constant speed until the elastic cord exerts a force on the cart. The motion of the cart is measured with the motion detector, and the force the elastic cord exerts on the cart is measured with the force sensor. Both sensors are set up so that the positive direction is to the left. The data recorded by both sensors are shown in the graphs of velocity as a function of time and force as a function of time below. (a) Calculate the mass m of the cart.

For time period from <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0.50</mn> <mtext> s</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr cacaaI3aGaaGynaiaabccacaqGZbaaaa@3A7B@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>, the force F the elastic cord exerts on the cart is given as a function of time t by the equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>F</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>A</mi> <mi>sin</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>ω</mi> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 </semantics> </math>, where <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>A</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mtext>6</mtext> <mtext>.3 N</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyqaiabg2 da9iaabAdacaqGUaGaae4maiaabccacaqGobaaaa@3B56@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>ω</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>12.6</mn> <mtext> rad/s</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaeqyYdCNaey ypa0JaaGymaiaaikdacaGGUaGaaGOnaiaabccacaqGYbGaaeyyaiaa bsgacaqGVaGaae4Caaaa@40BD@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. (b) Using the given equation, show that the area under the graph above is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>1.0</mn> <mtext> N•s</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGymaiaac6 cacaaIWaGaaeiiaiaab6eacaqGIaIaae4Caaaa@3B4C@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(c) The experiment is repeated using a different cord that exerts a larger average force on the cart. The cart starts and ends with the same speeds as those in the original experiment. Will the area for the graph of force as a function of time for the new cord be greater than, less than, or equal to the area for that of the original cord? ____Greater than ____Less than ____Equal to Justify your answer.

The elastic cord from the original experiment can be modeled as an ideal spring with force constant k . (d) Derive an expression for the maximum change in length <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>x</mi> <mrow> <mtext>MAX</mtext> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEamaaBa aaleaacaqGnbGaaeyqaiaabIfaaeqaaaaa@398E@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> for the cord. Express your answer in terms of m, k, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>v</mi> <mn>0</mn> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamODamaaBa aaleaacaaIWaaabeaaaaa@37D7@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>, and physical constants, as appropriate.

The student performs several trials of the experiment. For the first trial, the cart is empty. In each succeeding trial, a block is added to the cart. In all trials, the cart has an initial speed of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>2.0</mn> <mtext> m/s</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGOmaiaac6 cacaaIWaGaaeiiaiaab2gacaqGVaGaae4Caaaa@3B59@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> to the right, the cart rebounds to the left with a speed of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>2.0</mn> <mtext> m/s</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGOmaiaac6 cacaaIWaGaaeiiaiaab2gacaqGVaGaae4Caaaa@3B59@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>, and the maximum change in length of the elastic cord is measured. The total mass M of the cart and the maximum change in length of the cord in each trial are recorded in the table below. Total Mass of Cart M (kg) <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>x</mi> <mrow> <mtext>MAX</mtext> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEamaaBa aaleaacaqGnbGaaeyqaiaabIfaaeqaaaaa@398E@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> (m) 0.25 0.142 0.75 0.253 1.25 0.349 1.75 0.431 2.25 0.465 (e) Indicate below which quantities should be graphed to yield a straight line with a slope that could be used to calculate a numerical value for the force constant of the elastic cord k. Vertical axis: _________________ Horizontal axis: _________________ Use the remaining columns in the table on the previous page, as needed, to record any quantities that you indicated that are not given.

(f) Plot the data points for the quantities indicated in part (e) on the graph below. Clearly scale and label all axes, including units as appropriate. Draw a straight line that best represents the data.
(g) Use the best-fit line to calculate the force constant k of the elastic cord.

skill.text: 1.B: Create quantitative graphs with appropriate scales and units, including plotting data.
